DOC.brief_summary: Nowadays , eccentric exercise realize dynamic way ergocycle wich permit eccentric ( ECC ) low limbs contraction define power output . With type ergometer , O2 consumption ( VO2 ) ECC three fold low concentric ( CON ) power output . Consequently , ECC program could use chronic disorder limited capacity , obesity . The investigator hypothesis eccentric training program , induce high mechanical constraint , would improve body composition , especially reduce fat mass . This effect could explain increased rest energy expenditure well improvement biological parameter ( particularly lipid profile insulin-resistance ) ECC training ( versus CON training ) . This study aim compare modification fat mass ECC program versus CON program VO2 . The secondary goal assess physiological mechanism involve modification body composition
DOC.brief_title: Impact Training Program Body Composition Overweight Obese Young Adults : Concentric Versus Eccentric Exercise
DOC.detailed_description: Thirty adult randomize 2 group : CON EXC . The patient ECC group follow habituation session ( 2weeks ) avoid secondary muscular effect high intensity eccentric exercise . The training program last 12 week two group . Before , subject participate follow measurement : total segmental body composition ( DXA ) , aerobic capacity ( maximal incremental exercise test , VO2max ) , muscular low limbs strength ( isometric end isokinetic dynamometer ) , rest energy expenditure ( indirect calorimetry ) , biological parameter ( lipid profile , insulin-resistance ) , physical activity ( actimetry ) , food intake quality life ( questionnaire ) .
DOC.criteria: Adults Obese ( BMI > 35 ) Inactive ( < 10 METS/h/week ) No chronic disease ( cardio pulmonary , osteo articulary muscular disease ) , surgery last 3 month , contraindication physical activity ( BMI < 35 )
